title: Modi has good personal equation with Trump: EAM amid strained ties with US
content: Following positive remarks from Donald Trump, PM Modi reciprocated, hinting at a potential turnaround in the strained India-US relationship. External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasized India's commitment to the partnership, raising prospects of a phone call between the leaders.

title: Mercury levels in Delhi's air highest among 3 Indian cities studied, human activities blamed
content: A recent study by IITM reveals Delhi's air contains the highest mercury concentration among Indian cities, significantly exceeding global background levels. The study, spanning from 2018 to 2024, links the pollution to coal use, traffic, and industries. While Delhi's mercury levels are alarming, the research indicates a decline compared to previous years.

title: Pro-Khalistan outfits getting funds from Canada, its govt says
content: A Canadian government report reveals that pro-Khalistan terror groups like Babbar Khalsa International and International Sikh Youth Federation receive financial support within Canada. These groups, advocating for an independent state in Punjab through violent means, utilize various funding methods, including diaspora donations and abuse of financial sectors.

title: 'Isko abhi khila do': How Gill’s first net session stunned Kohli, Dhoni, Shastri
content: Sanjay Bangar shared a story. Shubman Gill's initial net practice amazed everyone. Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni, and Ravi Shastri were present. Gill's batting impressed Kohli. Kohli felt he lacked Gill's talent at 19. Shastri wanted Gill in the playing eleven immediately. Gill's talent was evident from the start. Everyone realized his special ability during that session.

title: Intel CEO tightens reins: No big design without his OK; sends message to staff
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan has initiated a hands-on leadership policy, personally reviewing and approving major chip designs before tape-out. This move aims to enhance execution, reduce costs, and regain competitiveness after a significant financial loss. The policy is part of a broader strategy to streamline operations and strengthen Intel's product roadmap amid pressure from competitors like TSMC.

title: FATF lauds work of MHA's portal for international cooperation
content: The FATF report commends India's online MLA portal for streamlining international cooperation in money laundering cases. An ED investigation, in collaboration with the US DOJ, dismantled a darknet-based Fentanyl syndicate, seizing significant Bitcoin assets. This joint effort highlights effective cross-border coordination and India's enhanced capacity for international legal assistance.

title: Blood Moon eclipse on Sept 7–8: 5 rare features revealed; visibility times across global regions
content: Get ready for a spectacular total lunar eclipse on September 7-8, 2025! The 'Blood Moon' will grace the night sky, turning a stunning red due to Rayleigh scattering. With a total phase lasting around 82 minutes, this eclipse will be visible across Asia, Australia, Africa, and Europe, offering a breathtaking celestial event for billions.

title: PM Modi dinner with NDA MPs called off amid floods across states
content: In light of the widespread devastation caused by severe floods in Punjab and other regions of India, BJP President JP Nadda's dinner for NDA MPs on Saturday and Prime Minister Modi's dinner on Sunday, scheduled before the Vice Presidential elections, have been cancelled. PM Modi is expected to visit the flood-affected areas.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
content: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.

title: Chiefs’ Xavier Worthy injury: Fans panic; experts weigh in — latest update
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans are anxious following reports of a potential shoulder dislocation for Xavier Worthy. A sports medicine specialist suggests a possible three-week recovery, but cautions about a high re-injury risk. Surgery, the worst-case scenario, could sideline Worthy for the season. His absence would force offensive adjustments, potentially impacting Mahomes and other receivers.

title: Pan-India SIR exercise will be spread over a month
content: The Election Commission of India is set to conduct a nationwide Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, mirroring the exercise recently held in Bihar. Scheduled to begin soon, this initiative aims to purify the rolls by removing ineligible voters and ensuring all eligible citizens are included.

title: Alcaraz vs Sinner: First time in 25 years! Trump to watch the US Open final
content: Donald Trump is set to attend the US Open men's final, marking his first appearance since 2015. He will be watching from Rolex's suite, despite his administration's recent imposition of a 39% tariff on Swiss products. This visit adds to Trump's recent attendance at major sporting events, though ABC's broadcast may avoid showing any potential protests.

title: Meta’s brain drain: Why AI engineers quit; startup CEO cites Zuckerberg’s own words
content: Memories.ai CEO Shawn Shen reveals that Meta's frequent reorganizations are driving AI researchers to seek opportunities elsewhere, including his own startup. Memories.ai is offering lucrative compensation packages, up to $2 million, to attract top talent. The company has already hired a former Meta research scientist as its chief AI officer and plans to expand its AI team significantly.

title: Movement curbs in Manipur stay despite open national highway
content: The reopening of National Highway-2, a vital supply route, has stirred unease in Manipur's peace process. Kuki-Zo armed groups, KNO and UPF, cautioned against interpreting it as acceptance of unrestricted movement between communities. This follows a renewed ceasefire agreement with the Centre, focusing on territorial integrity and a political solution.

title: Evander Kane’s fiancée Mara Teigen: Celebrates brother Sam’s 26th birthday — night out
content: Mara Teigen, Evander Kane's fiancée, celebrated her brother Sam's 26th birthday with a lively nightclub outing. She shared heartfelt Instagram stories, calling Sam her "best friend for life," highlighting their close sibling bond. The celebration offered fans a glimpse into Teigen's family-first values, showcasing that beyond her modeling career and relationship, family remains a priority.

title: US Open: Sabalenka breaks ‘unpredictable’ tag; turns lessons into legacy
content: Aryna Sabalenka defended her US Open crown in style, beating Amanda Anisimova 6-3, 7-6(3) for her fourth Grand Slam title and 100th major match win. The world No. 1 celebrated in a shimmering silver jacket that matched her trophy, blending grit with glamour on a rain-soaked New York night to become the first repeat champion since Serena Williams.

title: Er Rashid attacked in Tihar, party claims Kashmiri inmates being harassed
content: Engineer Rashid, a Baramulla MP, was reportedly attacked in Tihar Jail by transgender inmates following an altercation, sustaining minor injuries. His party, AIP, alleges a deliberate attempt to harm him and claims Kashmiri prisoners are being intentionally housed with transgender individuals who are encouraged to provoke them.

title: Will ensure your fiscal health is safeguarded: FM to states
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has reassured states about the Centre's commitment to their fiscal health, addressing concerns over potential revenue impacts from GST rate reductions. The recent GST council meeting rationalized rates, lowering levies on numerous items while adjusting slabs, aiming for an optimal balance between tax incidence and revenue generation.

title: Shilo Sanders NFL update: Waived by Bucs — still unsigned, future uncertain
content: Shilo Sanders, after being released by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers following a preseason ejection for throwing a punch, remains without an NFL team. Despite his agents seeking opportunities, including practice squad positions, no team has claimed him. The Toronto Argonauts hold his CFL rights, and the UFL could be an option next year if an NFL deal doesn't materialize.

title: Phillies ‘Karen’ slammed: Snatches HR ball — crowd cheers birthday boy
content: A birthday celebration took a turn when a woman grabbed a home run ball from a young Phillies fan. The incident triggered widespread condemnation online. Social media users criticized the woman's actions. The boy received gifts from the Marlins and a signed bat from Harrison Bader. The online community rallied to support the child.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
content: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Hazratbal row: BJP wants action; it's not a place for emblem, says Omar
content: Following the defacement of the national emblem at Srinagar's Hazratbal shrine, Ladakh LG Kavinder Gupta pledged strict action. Omar Abdullah criticized the emblem's placement, emphasizing its use in government functions, not religious sites. The NC demanded the removal of Waqf Board chairperson Darakhshan Andrabi, alleging misconduct and accusing her of instigating the crisis for political gain, while BJP defended Andrabi.

title: French president Macron briefs PM Modi on efforts to end Ukraine war
content: PM Modi and President Macron discussed the Ukraine conflict, with Macron briefing Modi on the Coalition of the Willing's meeting in Paris regarding security guarantees for Ukraine. Modi reiterated India's support for peaceful resolution and both leaders affirmed their commitment to strengthening the India-France Strategic Partnership across various sectors.

title: VinFast enters India with two electric SUVs
content: VinFast, the Vietnamese electric carmaker, has entered the Indian market with the launch of two electric SUVs, the VF6 and VF7. Priced starting at Rs 16.5 lakh and Rs 20.9 lakh respectively, these vehicles boast impressive ranges.

title: Jammu and Kashmir cop dies as boulder crashes on him in landslide
content: A special police officer in Ramban district died after being struck by a landslide-triggered boulder. In Udhampur, the IAF airlifted two critical patients from a flood-hit area, while a landslide destroyed a school and bridge.

title: Jeanie Buss & Luka Doncic: $15M tip rumor — fact or fiction? The truth revealed
content: Recent controversy involves Los Angeles Lakers' Jeanie Buss. Allegations suggest Buss tipped Luka Doncic's restaurant with $15 million. This follows discontent from the Kawhi Leonard-Steve Ballmer situation. An Instagram post featuring Buss, Doncic, and others fueled the rumors. However, Doncic does not own a restaurant. The league scrutinizes all controversies due to recent events.

title: Ambulance falls into gorge, three killed in Himachal
content: In a tragic incident, an ambulance carrying a patient to Ludhiana crashed into a gorge in Una district, Himachal Pradesh, resulting in the death of three individuals. The accident occurred near Gagret when the driver lost control on a curve near Manghuwal. Two others, including the driver, sustained severe injuries and were rushed to a nearby hospital.

title: GST cuts: Car, bike, FMCG and online platforms reduce prices
content: Following GST cuts by the government, companies across various sectors, including automotive, e-commerce, and FMCG, have begun reducing prices to pass on the benefits to consumers. Car manufacturers like Mahindra & Mahindra, Tata Motors, and Renault have announced price reductions on their models.

title: Fresh probe ordered into 2000 Chittisinghpora massacre in Kashmir
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has ordered a new investigation into the Chittisinghpora massacre of 2000, where 35 Sikhs were killed by Pakistan-backed terrorists. This announcement came after Sinha met with the Shaheed Singhs Welfare Organisation, who requested an inquiry and support for the victims' families.

title: 790-page chargesheet filed in honeymoon murder case
content: Meghalaya police filed a chargesheet against Sonam Raghuvanshi, her lover, and three others for allegedly murdering her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, during their honeymoon in Cherrapunji. The accused face charges of murder, evidence disappearance, and criminal conspiracy. A supplementary chargesheet is expected for three others accused of concealing evidence, who are currently on bail.

title: ‘Bihar-Bidi’ row: Kerala Cong admits 'mistake'; social media head meets leaders
content: A controversy erupted after Kerala Congress's social media post compared Bihar to a 'bidi', drawing criticism from the BJP and upsetting ally RJD. The post, a dig at GST rates, was deleted, and an apology was issued. Union Minister Chirag Paswan condemned the remark as defaming the people of Bihar, reflecting Congress's mindset.

title: Government fixes retail price of 42 common drug formulations
content: The government has set retail prices for 42 common drug formulations, including Meropenem & Sulbactam injection and Mycophenolate Mofetil tablets. The National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority (NPPA) has mandated manufacturers to issue price lists to dealers and state drug controllers.

title: SRK, Ranbir, Abhishek: Stars who own, play, and promote sports in India
content: Bollywood celebrities are increasingly involved in Indian sports, moving beyond mere spectators to become team owners, ambassadors, and even athletes. This infusion of star power brings attention, investment, and credibility to sports often overshadowed by cricket. Their genuine commitment fosters growth and development within India's diverse sports landscape, creating a symbiotic relationship between the entertainment and athletic worlds.

title: Lynx vs Valkyries: WNBA prediction, spread, top prop bets & players to watch
content: The Minnesota Lynx, the top seed, will clash with the Golden State Valkyries on September 6, 2025. The Valkyries, despite being an expansion team, are on a five-game winning streak and boast a strong home defense. While the Lynx are favored, the Valkyries' momentum and home-court advantage make them a dangerous underdog, potentially leading to a close, competitive game.

title: ED summons BJP man who alleges in court Rahul is a UK citizen
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has initiated an inquiry into Rahul Gandhi's alleged UK citizenship, based on a petition pending in the Allahabad High Court. The agency has summoned BJP member Vignesh Shishir, the petitioner, seeking details about Gandhi's alleged UK citizenship, associated companies, and foreign accounts.

title: 'I wasn’t sure … ': Zuckerberg's hot mic moment with Trump goes viral – watch
content: A White House dinner hosted by Donald Trump for tech leaders turned awkward when a hot mic caught Mark Zuckerberg admitting he inflated Meta's investment pledge. Other executives, including Tim Cook and Satya Nadella, also quantified their commitments, while Elon Musk was notably absent. The event highlighted Trump's evolving relationship with Silicon Valley despite earlier criticisms.

title: US tariffs: Trump signs order granting exemptions; zero duties begin Monday for 'aligned partners'
content: President Trump signed an executive order granting tariff exemptions to trading partners who reach agreements on industrial exports, including metals, pharmaceuticals, and chemicals. This move aims to reshape global trade, reduce deficits, and encourage concessions from partner nations. The exemptions, effective Monday, cover goods not sufficiently produced in the U.S. and align with existing agreements, potentially impacting countries like Switzerland.

title: Asia Cup: Abhishek, Sanju hit sixes for fun; top-order batters go aerial in Dubai nets
content: India's Asia Cup 2025 preparations intensified in Dubai, with top-order batsmen like Shubman Gill, Abhishek Sharma, and Suryakumar Yadav focusing on aggressive, aerial hitting during practice. Abhishek Sharma stood out with his effortless six-hitting. Bowlers Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh kept the intensity high, while coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Suryakumar Yadav were seen in tactical discussions.

title: 'Second in two days': Israel hits another Gaza highrise; 15-storey tower turns to dust - watch
content: Israeli forces struck the Sussi Tower in Gaza City, the second high-rise targeted in as many days, claiming Hamas used it for intelligence gathering. The military stated that precautions were taken to minimize civilian harm before the strike. This escalation occurs amid intensified Israeli operations and warnings for Gaza City residents to evacuate south.

title: Watch: Virender Sehwag opens up ahead of Asia Cup – 'Losing to Pakistan...'
content: Virender Sehwag revealed the emotional toll of India's losses to Pakistan, admitting they sometimes disrupted his focus. Despite averaging 50.65 against them, the frequent defeats affected him deeply. He fondly recalled his masterful 119 against Pakistan in 2008 while fasting, showcasing his determination. India is set to face Pakistan in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025.

title: BCCI report financial highs: Rs 14,627 crore added in five years
content: The BCCI has reported a substantial financial upswing, with bank balances soaring by Rs 14,627 crore since 2019, reaching Rs 20,686 crore last year. This growth is attributed to increased IPL surplus and ICC distributions, despite a dip in media rights income due to fewer international home matches.

title: Willander & Lekkerimäki: Canucks top prospects 2025-26 — full breakdown
content: Vancouver Canucks boast a strong prospect pool for the 2025-26 season. Young talents are nearing NHL readiness through strategic drafting and development. Tom Willander and Jonathan Lekkerimaki lead the next wave. Anthony Romani and Wilson Bjork are also developing. Ty Mueller may see a call-up soon. The Canucks are building a balanced pipeline for sustained success.

title: Asia Cup Hockey: India trounce China 7-0; to face Korea in final
content: India's men's hockey team stormed into the Asia Cup final, crushing China 7-0 in Rajgir, Bihar. Abhishek's two goals highlighted a dominant performance, with Shilanand Lakra initiating the scoring spree. Other contributors were Dilpreet Singh, Mandeep Singh, Raj Kumar Pal and Sukhjeet Singh.

title: Melo, Howard, Moore, Bird join hoops Hall of Fame
content: Carmelo Anthony, Dwight Howard, Sue Bird, Maya Moore and Sylvia Fowles were inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame on Saturday.

title: O's 1 out from being no-hit, score 4 to stun L.A.
content: Down by three and one out away from being no-hit, the Orioles stormed back for four runs to defeat the Dodgers 4-3 in a frantic ninth-inning comeback.

title: Source: Heyward agrees to revised Steelers deal
content: The Steelers and captain Cameron Heyward agreed Saturday night on a revised deal that will add over $3 million in incentives to his contract this year, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: UF 'not good enough,' says Napier after USF upset
content: Florida coach Billy Napier said his team's performance was just "not good enough" after 18 1/2-point underdog South Florida stunned the Gators 18-16 on Saturday.

title: 'It was time': No. 3 QB Staub stars in Colorado win
content: Redshirt sophomore Ryan Staub, Colorado's No. 3 quarterback, made a strong impression on head coach Deion Sanders, throwing for two touchdowns in a 31-7 win over Delaware.

title: 'Super proud' Sabalenka repeats as Open champ
content: Aryna Sabalenka beat Amanda Anisimova 6-3, 7-6 (3), making her the first woman to win the US Open in consecutive years since Serena Williams more than a decade ago.

title: Arch plays 'his game' as Texas rebounds with win
content: Texas coach Steve Sarkisian saw quarterback Arch Manning bounce back in a 38-7 win over San Jose State, saying this game showcased more of Manning's style.

title: Poch: USMNT better than South Korea despite loss
content: United States coach Mauricio Pochettino said that his team was "better than South Korea" despite a 2-0 home loss on Saturday in Harrison, New Jersey.

title: 🏈 The Playbook: Week 1 fantasy football guide
content: Mike Clay's Playbook now includes Shadow Reports, providing an all-encompassing look at Week 1's matchups to exploit and avoid in fantasy.

title: After a cruelly disappointing year, Aryna Sabalenka proves why she's No. 1
content: Top-ranked Sabalenka lost twice in a major final earlier in the year. But at the US Open, she finally won another Grand Slam title.

title: Last-minute Week 1 intel from NFL experts: Why the Lions could win, plus surprises and fantasy sleepers
content: Could Jahmyr Gibbs have a huge receiving game? Will the Bengals finally win in Week 1? Which two Jaguars should you add in your fantasy leagues?

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Seven potential difference-makers for Week 1
content: Liz Loza lays out the facts that affect her Week 1 fantasy football feelings on Baker Mayfield and others.

title: Experts' picks: Who will win the US Open men's title?
content: Sinner and Alcaraz will face off yet again in the US Open final Sunday. Our experts weigh in on how each can win.

title: Bills' 2022 draft class intends to make its mark as a new core in Buffalo.
content: A new core group rallies around QB Josh Allen as Buffalo seeks to continue its success for years to come.

title: 30 years later, remembering Ripken's record-setting streak
content: Thirty years after the epic night Cal Ripken set his Ironman streak, he and others remember the magic.

title: Who's next? Tiering Hall of Fame chances for 50 active NBA stars
content: From top-75 locks to vets on the bubble, Zach Kram runs down the active NBA players on the path to Springfield.

title: Will Fever make playoffs? Can Liberty still host? Breaking down the WNBA playoff picture
content: Six teams have clinched WNBA playoff bids, but seeding and the last two berths still need to be determined.

title: ↔️ Inside the Micah Parsons trade
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

title: 🤯 CFB overreactions: Belichick, Arch, more
content: What happened to Arch Manning? And Clemson?? And Alabama??? We jump to some way-too-early conclusions.

title: ⚾ Passan's early MLB free agency intel
content: MLB front offices are already thinking ahead to the offseason. Here are the storylines that will rule the winter.

title: 🏀 Report: Clips skirted cap with Kawhi payment
content: The Clippers reportedly have been accused of circumventing the NBA's salary cap by paying $28 million to Kawhi Leonard for a "no-show job."

title: 💰 Gundy, Lanning trade barbs over Ducks' budget
content: Oklahoma State's Mike Gundy and Oregon's Dan Lanning traded barbs Monday after Gundy called attention to the Ducks' sizable budget.

title: 🏀 Caitlin Clark to miss rest of Fever season
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who has been limited to 13 games because of injuries and hasn't played since July 15, will miss the remainder of the WNBA season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Could Man United go back in for Emi Martínez?
content: Emiliano Martínez's Aston Villa future remains uncertain after his failed move to Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 10 of the top women's transfers: Yohannes, Thompson, Clinton, more
content: The women's summer transfer window broke records and had some incredible moves. What were some of the best?

title: James Madison's icy white look headlines best Week 2 college football uniforms
content: James Madison will look to make a statement on the road against Louisville wearing a slick all-white look.

title: Travis Kelce talks engagement to Taylor Swift in Brazil
content: The Chiefs tight end kept things lighthearted about his relationship and engagement to the superstar singer/songwriter.

title: From No. 1 to ... the Rockies, again: Ranking all 30 MLB cores
content: Dodgers or Mariners? Mets or Phillies? We rank the clubs with the most star power under control through 2027.

title: Cloudburst hits Naugaon area in Uttarkashi; no loss of life so far
content: The cloudburst occurred at Syori Phal Patti in Yamuna Valley in the evening, and sludge from a flooded stream rushed downwards, inflicting damage in low-lying areas

title: Caste census: Clamour emerges over how sub castes are classified
content: The listing of sub-castes in alphabetical order, rather than under each caste as one category, has riled many communities

title: Britain's Crown Prosecution Service inspects Tihar jail as India intensifies efforts to extradite fugitives
content: According to information, the CPS team visited the high-security ward of Tihar and spoke with the prisoners there

title: Five persons booked for running mobile sex determination test unit in Tirupattur
content: All of them were booked under Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Act, 1971, by Kurusilapattu police in Tirupattur.

title: Youth held for selling painkiller tablets in Vellore
content: Investigations revealed the suspect Vishwa was selling the tablets for youth and students in the area.

title: Forest department initiates probe into fire in reserve forest atop Arunachala Hills
content: More than one acre of forest land was gutted in the incident. The hills are home to spotted deer, sloth bear, peacocks, monkeys and Indian gaur.

title: Arts and Science college in Vaniyambadi holds Graduation day
content: The executive director of VIT highlighted the importance of women’s empowerment and cited women achievers as examples

title: WBSSC to hold examination for teachers recruitment on September 7 amidst high security
content: About 3.19 lakh candidates will take the exam tomorrow for appointment as teachers for class IX and class X in state-run schools. The recruitment on the last occasion in 2016 was riddled with irregularities and corruption

title: Haryana government transfers 20 IAS officers, 1 HCS officer in major reshuffle
content: Munish Sharma, Deputy Commissioner, Charkhi Dadri, has been transferred and posted as Secretary, Haryana Board of School Education, Bhiwani, relieving Munish Nagpal of the charge

title: Is a shift underway in India’s foreign policy? | Explained
content: How productive was the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit? Did a meeting between China, Russia and India at Tianjin signal a change in relations? Did U.S. moves on tariffs and sanctions prompt this? What are the leaders saying?

title: Mumbai bids grand farewell to ‘Ganpati Bappa’ amid rains, bomb threat; over 18,000 idols immersed
content: According to the BMC, 18,186 Ganapati idols, 1,058 of ‘sarvajanik mandals’ (local community groups) and 258 of Goddess idols, were immersed in natural water bodies and artificial ponds created by the civic body till 9 p.m.

title: Rajendra Arlekar | Saffron guard
content: The Kerala Governor, a former functionary of the BJP, faces criticism for ‘saffronising’ education and violating constitutional propriety

title: BCCI adds ₹14,627 crore in five years, ₹4,193 crore in last financial year: Report
content: Aided by IPL earnings and ICC distributions, the BCCI posted a surplus of ₹1,623.08 crore for 2023-24, up from ₹1,167.99 crore in the previous year, according to the report

title: T.N. Health Minister flags air travelers’ woes, seeks Airbus services on key routes
content: Mr.Subramanian highlighted that, in recent times, passengers flying to Madurai from Chennai airport have been experiencing severe mental stress due to inadequate seating in shuttle buses

title: Opposition parties criticise DMK government for deterioration of law and order situation in T.N.
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami says the Chief Minister M.K. Stalin-led government has failed to maintain law and order and DMK functionaries being involved in criminal activities has become a regular occurrence

title: Tamil Nadu government introduces overseas scholarship for Muslim students
content: The scholarship will assist their higher studies if they are admitted to institutions ranked within the top 250 in the Global QS rankings

title: J&K parties seek removal of Waqf chairperson Darakshan Andrabi over ‘National Emblem plaque’ row
content: Chairperson placing a plaque with the National Emblem at the shrine sparks protests; BJP, Shiv Sena demand action against those who vandalised plaque

title: Science-based problem-solving should take an inclusive approach, says academic
content: Given the lack of adequate scientists and doctors across the globe, he points out that the role of community health workers was paramount and their access to right set of tools critical

title: Dinner gatherings at PM, BJP chief’s residences cancelled over floods in Punjab and other regions
content: While Friday brought some respite from the relentless rain, several northern Indian States grapple with the destruction left behind by the monsoon in the most affected areas

title: Supreme Court panel on students’ mental health gets State Nodal Officers; over 1 lakh survey responses received
content: The 12-member National Task Force was formed after parents of students who had died by suicide in higher education campuses had sought relief from the Supreme Court

title: Declining budget for MGNREGS means reduced income for women in rural India, say activists
content: Given the Finance Ministry’s directive capping the expenditure in the first two quarters at 60% of the total available budget, the Centre has only ₹79 crore under the programme for the month of September

title: Duty to Constitution lies with every lawyer, not just people in power corridors, says Justice Nagarathna
content: In a convocation address, the senior apex court judge exhorted law graduates to use their knowledge and skills to build inclusive institutions and promote systemic equity, becoming ‘true custodians of the rule of law’

title: Process has become punishment in criminal justice delivery: ex-CJI N.V. Ramana
content: At Lexposium 2025, organised by the SRM School of Law in association with The Hindu, the retired judge listed several factors that erode public trust on the judiciary, including pendency of cases and high costs of litigation

title: Police officers involved in Kunnamkulam custodial torture suspended
content: Police surveillance camera footage of the torture, procured through an uphill RTI litigation by the victim, a Youth Congress leader, had led to public outrage. Congress workers march to the residences of the suspended officers

title: Probe on voter fraud in Karnataka hits roadblock as Election Commission of India yet to share technical data
content: The Karnataka CID has been probing a systematic attempt to remove names of 5,994 voters from electoral rolls by forging Form 7, in the Aland Assembly constituency in Kalaburagi district, ahead of the 2023 Assembly election; many electors whose names were sought to be deleted and those whose credentials were misused to make the applications had filed complaints with the Aland Tehsildar

title: Sky-walk glass bridge another jewel in Visakhapatnam’s crown
content: Slated for inauguration soon, the bridge, touted to be the longest in the country, offers tourists a breathtaking view of the Bay of Bengal on the one side and the city on the other

title: Malayalis give kitchens a break with takeaway Onasadya
content: It was after COVID-19 that Malayalees began relying on caterers for their ‘Onasadya’. The trend soon gained popularity as families recognised its other benefits

title: Election Commission of India to hold State CEOs meeting on September 10 over SIR
content: All CEOs would be making presentations on September 10 regarding the number of voters in their States and U.T.s and details of the last intensive revision, the official said

title: Kerala to usher in foreign tourist season with a mixed bag of hopes
content: Rise of Sri Lankan tourism has been posing a big challenge to Kerala as the holistic treatment offered by the State at a rate of $150 is now offered for $100 by Sri Lanka

title: Super-speciality hospital in Hassan will be ready in eight months: Karnataka Revenue Minister
content: Krishna Byregowda, Revenue Minister, redressed public grievances during his visit to Hassan on Saturday

title: Former Union Minister Ashwani Kumar demands special financial package from Centre for flood-hit Punjab
content: Mr. Kumar says Union Agriculture Minister’s recent visit to Punjab to survey the devastation caused by the unprecedented floods should be followed by immediate relief to the farmers and the affected people in distress

title: In Edamalakkudy, the sick are denied treatment by poor roads
content: An elderly woman had to be carried on a stretcher for 10 km through dense forest to the hospital. Tribespeople point out that the lack of proper roads has already claimed two lives in the recent past

title: Karnataka’s infant mortality rate falls by one point: SRS 2023
content: A matter of concern is that rural areas continue to report a higher number of infant deaths compared to urban areas.

title: Ganesh immersion processions turns into a divine encounter for millions
content: On the streets ringing the historic Hussainsagar Lake, where most of the processions converged, there was an air of festive carnival with people dressed up for the occasion

title: Papaya farmers told not to sell produce below ₹8 a kg in Annamayya district
content: Collector inspects papaya plantations in Chitvel and Penagalur mandals, and interacts with farmers, taking a note of their grievances about falling prices

title: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy lays foundation stone for ₹5 crore bus stand in Aland
content: Ramalinga Reddy said that the proposal for the recruitment of 2,736 transport staff was sent to the Finance Department for approval

title: Allahabad High Court gets two new judges
content: With the new appointments, the Allahabad High Court will now have 86 judges against a sanctioned strength of 160.

title: Kerala plans showcasing Onam festivities to international tourists
content: Through its Cultural Exchange Programme, Kerala seeks to position itself as a premier destination for cultural tourism while highlighting Onam as one of India’s most iconic festivals

title: Agriculture department’s nod for revised estimate of ₹134 crore for integrated agri complex project at Anayara
content: Project consists of agri tower, an integrated administrative hub for the Agriculture department and allied farm sector agencies, as well as an exhibition centre, and a food court

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder case: Raja Raghuvanshi’s family demands death penalty for wife Sonam, others
content: Meghalaya Police files a 790-page chargesheet in court against the five accused who were allegedly hired to kill Raja, a businessman from Indore during his honeymoon with Sonam in the Northeastern State in May

title: Questions raised over logic of using ballot papers for local body elections
content: If the real issue is erosion of trust, the solution is not to abandon EVMs but to enhance trust-building mechanisms, said an officer

title: Sudhakaran criticises Satheesan for Onam dinner with CM amid row over police assault
content: The footage of a Youth Congress leader being assaulted by the police at the Kunnamkulam police station has sparked condemnation all over the State

title: Three arrested within 24 hours in Dharmavaram murder case
content: Murder was an act of revenge by a local merchant and his business partners for the death of his father during a brawl last year, according to the police

title: Bangladeshi woman’s arrest in Mumbai leads police to Telangana drug manufacturing hub
content: Officers from Mumbai police arrest owner of Vagdevi Laboratories Pvt Ltd, and a chemical analyst, seize 5.8 kgs of mephedrone, 35,500 litres of chemicals

title: 'Hottest place to be': Trump unveils renovated Rose Garden Club

title: ‘Chipocalypse Now’: Trump threatens Chicago with national guard
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Delhi Court Restrains Activists From Publishing Defamatory Content Against Adani Enterprises
content: In a major relief to Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL), a Delhi court on Saturday restrained certain journalists and others from publishing unverified defamatory content against the company.

title: "Fellow Hyderabadi": Asaduddin Owaisi Says AIMIM Will Back INDIA Bloc's Sudershan Reddy In Veep Poll
content: Sudershan Reddy, a retired Supreme Court judge, is pitted against incumbent Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan for the post of Vice President.

title: UP Girl, 11, Raped By Married Man Gives Birth, Child Dies Minutes Later
content: The girl's family discovered her pregnancy on Thursday after she complained of persistent stomach pain, leading them to get an ultrasound test at a government hospital, which revealed she was seven months pregnant.

title: Lord Ganesha Visarjan 2025 Live Updates: Hundreds Of Idols Brought To Mumbai's Girgaon Chowpatty
content: Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations are set to conclude today with Ganesh Visarjan, the final day of the 10-day Ganeshotsav celebrations which began on August 27.

title: Prince Harry Reveals What "Broke" Him At Mother Princess Diana's Funeral
content: Prince Harry was 12 and his brother, Prince William, was 15 when their mother died, and they famously walked behind her coffin during her funeral procession.

title: Seoul Says Over 300 South Koreans Held In US Battery Plant Site Raid
content: More than 300 South Koreans were among 475 people arrested by US immigration officials in a raid on a Hyundai-LG battery plant being built in the southern US state of Georgia, the foreign minister in Seoul said on Saturday.

title: Late Night Break-In At Madhya Pradesh Congress Chief's Home
content: More than half a dozen masked men entered the home of Madhya Pradesh Congress President Jitu Patwari on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday.

title: UK Police Arrest Dozens At Latest Protest For Banned 'Palestine Action'
content: British police arrested dozens more people on Saturday under anti-terrorism laws for demonstrating in support of Palestine Action, a pro-Palestinian group banned by the government as a terrorist organisation.

title: Why 15-Year-Old Carlo Acutis Is Set To Become The First Millennial Saint
content: At a Catholic school in Pope Leo XIV's hometown, fifth graders read comic books about Carlo Acutis' life titled "Digital Disciple."

title: 2-Year-Old Girl Sleeping On Roadside Crushed To Death By Car In Mumbai: Cops
content: A two-year-old girl died and her brother was injured while they were asleep on the roadside as a car ran over them in Kalachowkie area of the city in the early hours of Saturday, police said.

title: Case Against 2 RSS Workers For Making Floral Carpet With Words 'Op Sindoor' In Kerala
content: Kerala Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Rajeev Chandrasekhar demanded the withdrawal of an FIR filed by state police over a Pookkalam that carried words "Operation Sindoor," calling it an insult to the victims of terrorism and to soldiers.

title: Vatican Receives First LGBTQ Pilgrimage
content: In a first for the Vatican, more than a thousand LGBTQ Catholics and their supporters are this weekend holding a pilgrimage, in what they are promoting as an important sign of diversity in the Church.

title: Merger Talks Gain Pace As NDPP Urges Neiphiu Rio To Return To "Political Home"
content: As the ruling Nationalist Democratic Progressive Party and Naga People's Front possibly inch closer to a merger, the latter's chief Apong Pongener has offered to resign to make way for Nagaland Chief Minister Neiphiu Rio to take over the post.

title: Ex-Astronomer HR And Husband File For Divorce 1 Month After Kiss Cam Scandal
content: On July 16, Astronomer CEO Andy Byron was caught on camera in what appeared to be an intimate position with the company's Chief Public Officer Kristen Cabot at the Coldplay concert in Boston.

title: 'Want Students To Study It': Russian Minister Pushes For Hindi In Universities
content: Deputy Minister of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation, Konstantin Mogilevsky has pushed for Hindi to be studied at university level in Russian Universities.

title: "Crucial Step For Peace": Arambai Tenggol On Suspension Of Operations Pact Renewal In Manipur
content: The Meitei organisation Arambai Tenggol (AT) on Saturday said the renegotiated suspension of operations (SoO) pact between the Centre and Kuki, Zomi and Hmar armed groups is crucial for achieving peace in Manipur.

title: UP Judge, Restaurateur File Cross Complaints After Parking Dispute In Goa
content: A judge from Uttar Pradesh and her husband as well as the owner of a restaurant filed cross complaints following a dispute over parking in Anjuna in Goa, a police official said on Saturday.

title: Omar Abdullah's Party Seeks J&K Waqf Chief's Sacking After Hazratbal Vandalism
content: The ruling National Conference in Jammu and Kashmir have called for the removal of the J&K Waqf board chairperson a day after the national emblem was defiled at the Hazratbal shrine in Srinagar.

title: Rape Accused TV Actor Ashish Kapoor Sent To 14 Day Judicial Custody
content: Television actor Ashish Kapoor, who was arrested on charges of raping a woman during a house party in Delhi last month, has been sent to 14 days of judicial custody.

title: Man Creates Fake Bills Worth Rs 10 Crore To Claim Rs 1.8 Crore GST, Arrested
content: A former employee of a private firm in Noida has been arrested for allegedly generating fake invoices of around Rs 10 crore to fraudulently claim input tax credit of Rs 1.8 crore, police said on Saturday.

title: 'Crap note': Peter Navarro slams Musk’s X feature; renews attack on India

title: NFL Week 1 best bets: Will the underdogs deliver?
content: we'll aim to do each week in this space -- finding value . Ben Solak and Seth Walder pick out plus-expected value bets . there have been 48 favorites of at least six points in the past decade of opening weeks .

title: Leclerc on Monza hopes: 'Don't have a chance'
content: Charles Leclerc leads the italian GP by 45th career pole position . he has won twice for Ferrari at monza in 2019 and again in 2024 . the GP is the homecoming for the championship-contending McLaren drivers .

title: After dominating in college, Titans' Cam Ward is ready to make NFL debut
content: rookie WRs Elic Ayomanor and Chimere Dike were on the field for an extra 40 minutes . the Titans coach Brian Callahan wanted the players back because they were returning from a weekend break . callahan is the only two quarterbacks selected to win their NFL debuts since 2002 .
